Name: Treasures in the Painting
Description: Some part of the painted tower is glowing.
QuestDesc: Some part of the painted tower is glowing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Claudia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nice to meet you, traveler from afar. I'm Claudia V. Fisalia, a traveling painter currently working on my landscape paintings.

Dialogues.Speaker: Claudia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I hope your time in Ragunna leaves you with beautiful memories.

Dialogues.Speaker: Claudia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your eyes shine with a brilliance akin to the Sentinel's radiance... If you don't mind, would you accept this painting?

Options.PlotLineKey: Oh, thank you. But maybe it's a bit too much...

Dialogues.Speaker: Claudia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No worries, it's just my personal creation and not something for sale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Claudia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I wish to paint the history within my heart and share it with those I feel are destined to connect with the Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmmm, this blue seems a bit too saturated...

Dialogues.Speaker: Actor No. 1
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cobalt blue and deep purple are the classical colors for deep sea, but is it truly the right choice for Fisalia?

Dialogues.Speaker: Claudia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm curious, though it's a bit embarrassing to ask... What do you think of my artwork, {PlayerName}?

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm curious about the towers in the painting.
The use of color is truly distinctive.

Dialogues.Speaker: Claudia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you referring to the Thorncrown Rises? Once engraved with the history of Fisalia, they are now merely three abandoned structures on the sea ridge.

Dialogues.Speaker: Claudia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In my childhood, I heard stories that the hidden main tower was the resting place for my family's first honors.

Dialogues.Speaker: Claudia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What does that truly mean? Does the Fisalia family really have any honor left to speak of now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Claudia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Distinctive use of color, you say? They're actually my attempts to depict the legacy of the Fisalia family through color.

Dialogues.Speaker: Claudia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why has the Fisalia family become like this? As someone not of the senior line, I can only speculate in this way now.
